description: Triangle of C(2n,k) with n >= k.
comments: From _Wolfdieter Lang_, Sep 19 2012 (Start)The triangle a(n,k) appears in the formula F(2*l+1)^(2*n) = (sum(a(n,k)*L(2*(n-k)*(2*l+1)),k=0..n-1) + a(n,n))/5^n, n>=0, l>=0, with F=A000045 (Fibonacci) and L=A000032 (Lucas).The signed triangle as(n,k):=a(n,k)*(-1)^k appears in the formula F(2*l)^(2*n) = (sum(as(n,k)*L(4*(n-k)*l),k=0..n-1) + as(n,n))/5^n, n>=0, l>=0. Proof with the Binet-de Moivre formula for F and L and the binomial formula. (End)
links: E. H. M. Brietzke, An identity of Andrews and a new method for the Riordan array proof of combinatorial identities, Discrete Math., 308 (2008), 4246-4262.
